measured_by: hypocritical blame index (discrepancy between own harmful-choice likelihood and blame judgments)
justification: “We calculated, for each participant, a 'hypocritical blame' index that quantified discrepancies between their current blame judgments and the choices they made a week earlier.”

measured_by: κ parameter from computational model of the moral decision task
justification: “The harm aversion parameter, κ, indicates the relative weight participants place on shocks over money in the valuation process…κ takes on different values in the Self and Other conditions (κself and κother).”

measured_by: single-item self-report rating of ‘facing a moral dilemma’ (1–7 Likert scale)
justification: “After participants completed the moral decision-making task…they indicated their subjective perception of ‘facing a moral dilemma’ during the task on a 7-point Likert scale.”

measured_by: visual analogue scale ratings of blameworthiness in the moral judgment task
justification: “Participants were asked to judge the blameworthiness of each harmful choice on that specific trial on a visual analog scale ranging from ‘not at all blameworthy’ to ‘extremely blameworthy’.”

measured_by: Guilt-Related Brain Signature (GRBS) pattern expression in fMRI
justification: “We leveraged a multivariate brain-based classifier…a previously validated brain-based signature of guilt (Guilt-Related Brain Signature, GRBS) to identify brain states that positively predict guilt.”
